description: From Old French *azimut (modern French azimut), from Arabic اَلسُّمُوت‎ pl (as-sumūt, “the directions”).

entries.meaning: An arc of the horizon intercepted between the meridian of the place and a vertical circle passing through the center of any object.
examples: the azimuth or bearing of a line surveying

entries.meaning: The quadrant of an azimuth circle.
